@ XxFukenGruvenxX: Here's a workaround.

"Black Satin No 3D" Skin for PowerDVD 10 Mark II

Changes between the default and the modified skin:

- Removed the 3D buttons and features
- Changed the autohide delay from the tabs to 1 sec (default = 3)
- Smaller Mini Mode: removed the Cyberlink logo & the Config button
- The Mini Mode has a glass background (Windows Vista & Windows 7)
- Fixed Mini Mode buttons (the white lines) + black Volume Control
- Removed the Upgrade button and the divider before the Help button

http://h*tfile.com/dl/94923667/42411d8/BlackSatinNo3D.zip.html (replace * with o)

Install: Extract to the skins directory and run the batch file

Hello, forgive me for being a bit thick but I am a little lost trying to get the black skin to work. Where exactly do I find (or need to create) the skins directory . Other than that problem I thank you ADHDerby from the bottom of my heart, this software is great and installed like a dream, as you said it would.

@ ADHDerby
i can't wait :)

I'll be on the lookout for your next update !

@ dekayw
Copy the 2 '.dll' files and '.reg' file into the 'Skins' folder, located in CyberLink's installation directory.. usually it's "C://Program Files/CyberLink/PowerDVD/ .... "

Then double-click the '.reg. file to add into your registry.

Start CyberLink, and you will not see the new skin.

thanks again for your help

Solved my own problem, I pulled out the "blacksatin" files and renamed the "Black" files to "Blacksatin"
Still don't know why the .bat files didn't do the job but this works for me,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,, Im going now to get the TPB skin torrent............. Best regardes and a last (for now) thanks to ADHderby

Hello, I've a problem. Ik downloaded this torrent http://thepiratebay.org/torrent/5983576/Pillars.of.the.Earth.720p.BluRay.X264-REWARD . I don't get any sound. I thought it had something to do with the fact that those .mkv-files have DTS audio (the torrent uses DTS 1509kbps
), but then again PowerDVD 10 is DTS-audio compatible, isn't? (By the way the same story when I use Divx Player Plus) Or are the files the problem? Could someone help me out here, thanx in advance!

@ 2311 

do you get sound from other videos?

if so, then you probably have DTS/High Def audio turned off in settings. Just go into the Audio Options of PowerDVD, and play around with the settings and it will work.

@ dekayw: The batch files (.bat) and reg files are designed to work on 32 and 64-bit versions of Windows. Just restart PowerDVD and the skin should be switched.

@ 2311 and XxFukenGruvenxX: PowerDVD 10 only plays MKV files that follow the MKV specification - http://www.matroska.org/technical/specs/codecid/index.html
If the MKV file contains an unspecified audio format, it won't play the audio. :/

If you want to play it with PowerDVD, you can mux the files to M2TS with tsMuxeR and it will play the audio.

Hey ADHDerby, many thanks here - I downloaded and installed this wonderful app, but every time I restart my PC, the Windows Installer tries to continue the installation process, fails to find a particular file (PowerDVD.msi - which DOES exist), and the installation process fails.  The app seems to work, but I want to clean up this problem, and I can't even delete the app via the Control Panel for the same reason, it looks for the same file and fails.  Any suggestions?

Download and run CLCleaner-PowerDVD10.0.exe - http://forum.cyberlink.com/forum/posts/downloadAttach/3452.page (rename .e__ to .exe)
Reboot and install PowerDVD with Administrator rights.

PowerBackup: http://www.cyberlink.com/products/powerbackup/overview_en_US.html
